intro: Pedicularis elwesii subsp. elwesii, commonly known as the Elwes's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers, which are often adorned with dark markings. It typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
